item.title: Europe floods: At least 120 dead and hundreds unaccounted for
item.description: As many as 1,300 people are still unaccounted for after the worst flooding in decades.

item.title: South African says riots over Zuma jailing pre-planned - Cyril Ramaphosa
item.description: At least 212 people are now known to have died in unrest sparked by the jailing of Jacob Zuma.

item.title: US Navy: First woman passes elite training scheme
item.description: The gruelling military training programme ends with a 72-hour event called the Tour.

item.title: Bianca Devins: Family sue NY officials over video footage of murdered teen
item.description: Bianca Devins' family claim video of her having sex and also her murder were shared with the media.

item.title: Belgium takes back mothers and children from Syria jihadist camps
item.description: It is the biggest repatriation of suspected Islamic State members since its fall in 2019.

item.title: Pulitzer-winning journalist killed in Afghanistan
item.description: Danish Siddiqui, an award-winning photographer with Reuters news agency, is killed on assignment.

item.title: Floridians rally in support of Cuban protesters
item.description: Across Florida, Cuban-Americans have been rallying to show their support for protests in Cuba.

item.title: Australia Covid: Melbourne's snap lockdown sparks protest
item.description: Anti-lockdown demonstrators take to the streets as the country's Delta outbreak spreads.

item.title: Lil Durk: Grammy-nominated US rapper in shootout with intruders
item.description: The Grammy-nominated star, who recently topped the US album chart, was not injured in the incident.

item.title: Biden and Merkel 'united against Russia aggression'
item.description: "Good friends can disagree," Mr Biden says of their dispute over a Russia-to-Germany pipeline.

item.title: WhatsApp blocks two million Indian accounts
item.description: The messaging platform said most of these users violated the bulk messaging rules.

item.title: Canada: More unmarked graves likely at former residential school site
item.description: An indigenous group said in May it had found the probable remains of 215 children in unmarked graves.

item.title: Dying alone in Indonesia's grim battle with Covid-19
item.description: Firefighters haul bodies from homes as hospitals scramble for oxygen in Asia's new Covid epicentre.

item.title: Viewpoint: Why Sikhs celebrate kindness
item.description: A new book asks why Sikhs have made it a tradition to help strangers in their darkest moments.

item.title: South Africa Zuma riots: Fact-checking claims about the protests
item.description: We've looked at some examples of misleading images and videos, claiming to be from the current protests.

item.title: Canada residential schools: 'Six years old, I was imprisoned here'
item.description: As searches for unmarked graves continue, survivors reflect on a dark legacy of residential schools.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 9-15 July 2021
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent and beyond.

item.title: How your personal data is being scraped from social media
item.description: As hackers scoop up data from social media sites, should firms be taking better care of your data?

item.title: Europe floods: Drone footage shows mudslides in western Germany
item.description: Houses have collapsed in the town of Erfstadt-Blessem following record rainfall.

item.title: Europe floods: Neighbourhoods clear up after record rainfall
item.description: BBC Netherlands correspondent Anna Holligan is in Valkenburg, where some residents have been forced to leave their homes.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The gymnasts 'building bridges between cultures'
item.description: The town of Murayama in northern Japan is preparing to welcome a team of Bulgarian Olympians.

item.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories: Why Hollywood stars like Ryan Reynolds are lining up
item.description: Other stars to have taken part include Tom Hardy, Dolly Parton and Sir Elton John. Here's why.

item.title: South Africa riots: The community standing up to looters
item.description: The government has said it will deploy 25,000 troops, but some residents are already taking action.

item.title: Germany floods: Where are the worst-hit areas?
item.description: Maps, images and graphics showing the heavy rainfall and flooding that has caused widespread damage.

item.title: Germany floods: 'My city looks like a battlefield'
item.description: Witnesses voice their grief and horror at the deadly floods in western Germany.

item.title: Germany floods: How a country was taken by surprise
item.description: Amid the despair and mounting death toll, people are questioning how this could have happened.

item.title: In pictures: Chaos and destruction around Europe
item.description: Record rainfall caused rivers to burst their banks, leaving at least 122 dead in Germany and Belgium.

item.title: Science failed to predict extreme weather
item.description: Scientists want a super-computer powerful enough to accurately project the most damaging extremes.
